algorithm_technique: Sorting and then iterating in chunks of 3 to check the difference condition.
problem_summary_simple: Divide an array into groups of three where the difference between max and min in each group is at most k.
problem_summary_technical: Sort the array and form triplets. Check if the difference between the third and first element of each triplet is <= k.
key_insights: Sorting is crucial to easily check the difference between the smallest and largest elements in a potential group.
The condition `nums[i+2] - nums[i] <= k` efficiently checks the maximum difference within a sorted triplet.
If the sorted array can be divided, then any valid division must use consecutive elements from the sorted array.
